blurb: Joffrey is spoiled, arrogant, cowardly, childish and sadistic, though he tends to hide these traits before his ascension, appearing to be the typical charming heir to Seven Kingdoms.
Arya rejects the notion that she must become a lady and marry for influence and power. Instead, she believes that she can forge her own destiny.
Knowing his prospects are limited by his status as a bastard, Jon joins the Night's Watch, who guard the far northern borders from the wildlings living beyond The Wall.

Cersei, the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms by marriage, is considered one of the most complex characters in the realm. She possesses a lust for power, transgressive viewpoint, scheming, and her love for her children, whom she seeks to protect at all costs.

Daenerys, The Mother of Dragons, dreams of finding a peaceful home and a place to belong to. Despite her strong moral compass, she can deal ruthlessly with her enemies. She establishes herself as a powerful and relentless ruler.
Although his real name is Walder, he is commonly called 'Hodor' because that is the only word he is capable of saying.
